column4: Good night guys. Maybe someone could help me? I might have rebooted my system before the upgrade to 11.04 was over (the login screen was showing "reboot needed" or something to that effect). Now the box won't boot, and the kernel/dist is not showing on GRUB screen. Can I salvage it with a 10.10 live (USB)?
So, is it at the place where it shows grub> ?
Sorry, no. The actual boot screen (to select the kernel version)
Ahh okay, I see what you mean now.
Do you know if I CHROOT to the partition and do a dist-upgrade would work?
hmm, I'm not sure... I never had that problem, so yeah :/ today, I had a different problem where grub2 wouldn't recognize my kernel :/
Well, I think the worse it could do is finish destroying the install... Not too different of the current situation... :-)
Just an update... Tried the apt-get dist-upgrade, the machine complained and asked for a "dpkg --configure -a". It's still running, I think it's finishing the upgrade... Still hopeful... ;-)
yeah it must be, so when that finishes it should work :)
It was a LOT of work and wait, but it worked. Natty Narwhal is running... ;) Thanks again!
